decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of creature removal, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. The strategy involves using cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Dig Through Time to filter through the deck and find key pieces, while also utilizing powerful removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Bile Blight to keep the opponent's board in check. With planeswalkers like Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon providing additional threats and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can secure a win condition.

The main idea of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to consistently apply pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Mantis Rider, supported by burn spells such as Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames. The deck aims to control the board early on with efficient removal spells like Wild Slash and Valorous Stance, while also utilizing Outpost Siege for card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Soulfire Grand Master and Treasure Cruise provide additional value and flexibility in longer games. The land base is designed to ensure smooth mana development for casting spells on curve.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster, Mantis Rider, and Seeker of the Way. It also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Strike, Stoke the Flames, and Wild Slash to maintain control of the board and finish off their opponent. Supporting cards like Soulfire Grand Master and Elspeth, Sun's Champion provide additional value and utility, while cards like Dig Through Time and Temple of Triumph help ensure card advantage and consistency in drawing into key pieces of the deck.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells, counter magic, and powerful planeswalkers such as Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Garruk, Apex Predator. The deck also utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's card draw engine is supported by powerful delve spells like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise. With a consistent mana base and a mix of versatile spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy game.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on early game disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Drown in Sorrow, while also having resilient threats in Fleecemane Lion, Siege Rhino, and Courser of Kruphix. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm, while generating card advantage with cards like Read the Bones. The deck also has powerful finishers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out games. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color strategy with a mix of dual lands and mana-fixing lands.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up powerful, heroic creatures by targeting them with spells and triggering their abilities. By utilizing cards like Battlewise Hoplite, Favored Hoplite, and Hero of Iroas, along with combat tricks such as Ajani's Presence and Feat of Resistance, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with an aggressive playstyle. The inclusion of Aqueous Form and Ordeal of Thassa provides additional ways to trigger heroic abilities and draw cards, while cards like Seeker of the Way offer additional flexibility and resilience in combat situations.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, using low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By playing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Hordeling Outburst, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off with direct damage spells like Wild Slash, Searing Blood, and Lightning Strike. The high number of creatures and burn spells, along with a high ratio of Mountains in the mana base, allows for a consistent and powerful offensive strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and graveyard interaction to overwhelm the opponent and maintain board presence. By combining creatures like Courser of Kruphix and Sidisi, Brood Tyrant with removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Murderous Cut, it aims to control the board while also generating value from the graveyard. The inclusion of cards like Whip of Erebos and Hornet Queen provide additional sources of recursion and token generation, giving the deck multiple avenues to close out games quickly through aggressive plays and attrition.

This deck focuses on using a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells, and card advantage to pressure the opponent and disrupt their game plan. The deck relies on a solid mana base to consistently cast powerful threats like Siege Rhino and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Bile Blight. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Liliana Vess provide additional value and ways to close out the game. By playing aggressively and efficiently, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures such as Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix, backed up by powerful removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Bile Blight. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and versatile cards like Abzan Charm provide additional avenues to apply pressure and control the game. The deck is designed to have a balanced mix of threats and answers, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and strategies in a Standard 1 vs 1 environment.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Anafenza, Siege Rhino, and Tasigur, while also utilizing removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm to control the board. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Elspeth and Sorin, Solemn Visitor provide additional threats and value. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early with its creature base, while being able to handle threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan with its removal suite. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, ensuring a smooth and consistent gameplay experience.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with a fast and efficient creature base, including Fleecemane Lion, Rakshasa Deathdealer, Siege Rhino, and Wingmate Roc. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm to control the board. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and versatile creatures like Anafenza, the Foremost and Tasigur, the Golden Fang adds additional threats and resources to help maintain dominance throughout the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Seeker of the Way to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes removal spells like Chained to the Rocks and Lightning Strike to control the board and clear a path for attacking. Cards like Outpost Siege and Hordeling Outburst provide card advantage and allow for additional threats to be generated. The deck aims to close out games quickly by utilizing burn spells like Stoke the Flames and fast, evasive threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Ashcloud Phoenix.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and dealing damage to the opponent with efficient creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Ashcloud Phoenix, along with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames. It aims to end the game quickly with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage, while also utilizing cards like Seeker of the Way and Soulfire Grand Master for additional value. Chained to the Rocks helps control the opponent's creatures, while Outpost Siege provides card advantage to maintain a constant stream of threats.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence using aggressive creatures like Seeker of the Way, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Mantis Rider. These creatures are supported by burn spells like Wild Slash, Stoke the Flames, and Lightning Strike to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Soulfire Grand Master and Outpost Siege provide additional value and advantage in the mid to late game. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain that pressure throughout the game to quickly defeat the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressively building up a board presence with small, efficient creatures like Mantis Rider and Goblin Rabblemaster, while using burn spells like Wild Slash and Lightning Strike to clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes powerful spells like Stoke the Flames and Dig Through Time to close out games quickly. Jeskai Charm and Valorous Stance provide flexibility in dealing with threats, while cards like Soulfire Grand Master and Seeker of the Way provide additional lifegain and resilience. Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker adds a powerful finisher to the deck.
